posts.content:
1956 Volkswagen 23 Window Deluxe Sunroof RHD Price: £105000
Factory Right Hand Drive 1956 23 Window Deluxe. Delivered to Sweden in April of 56.
Factory Stiftung Certificate matches, including accessory steering lock.
I have owned this bus for 20 years, restored over that time, very low miles since.
Ally trim is original to this bus, correct original barndoor bumper. Skylights and corners original to this bus. upper metalwork was all good and required nothing, lower body is restored to exacting standards and is 100% rust free. Carefully matched Sealing Wax/Chestnut Brown paint.

Wheels are Genuine Empi 5 lug Sprintstars, Skinny fronts.

Engine 1776cc Twin 40 Webers, CSP linkage, Mallory distributor, A1 Headers sidewinder ceramic coated and Magnaflow muffler. Pulls strong. Low miles. Automatic Fire suppression system.

GT straight axle gearbox, Berg shifter, early type3 drums on the back.

Front suspension is a new narrowed roller bearing beam & dropped spindles.
German CSP disks on the front.

New wiring harness, NOS rear lights, original center brake light. Semaphores are non functioning, the blinkers are used for safety.
NOS accesory Hella high/low and turn stalks, flashing.
Autometer tach. Original deluxe clock. coathooks & jailbars all original to this bus.

Interior - Recovered correct light brown front bench. RHD Early Devon camping interior in oak. Handmade 100% Woolcloth headliner, as is the DuckCloth Sunroof cover. Matches the chestnut paint. Rear seating and floor matches the Sealing wax paint. Original gas cooker, converts to a bed, in the usual Devon way.

Creative Safaris and all 8 popouts on genuine long latches.

Located in London England.

Here is a video of the bus driving..
https://vimeo.com/noexitplan/vwbus

Sorry not to sound disrespectful but price drop to what ? 105k to ?

105k outside London buys a lot

It's a lovely bus but ......


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

Hi Starsky, I edited the post, it was 115k.
105k buys a lot everywhere. its a lot of money. there are a few early 23s at around the 160-170 mark so I thought this at least not the top end of asking prices. The split bus pricing debate has been going on for 25 years to my knowledge, and probably decades before that too, I'm into early Harleys, and they are at the 30-50k mark so expensive classics isn't solely the domain of busses.

Damon.

A very nice bus and honestly too cheap, just look around at what prices a top end 21 window LHD drive bus is making (I know of at least 4 at £140k plus) and that makes this RHD 23 window a bargain

No idea what the guys going on about regarding London, that's house prices dude not bus prices - why would anyone think or expect it to be more expensive because it lives in London!

Good luck with the sale, the bus is in no way overpriced it's more to do with the fact there are very few people nowadays who have £100k to spend on any car, regardless of make

Orb
cool ride

orb wrote: ↑Mon Jan 08, 2018 12:26 pm A very nice bus

Orb
Appreciate it dude.
show me a 23 window house for 105 grand nice bus too cheap glws

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.
